poem:
**A New Age?**

A speech on
brick and mortar
turns sour—

the steelworker's sweat
dismissed, 
folded
into idle scapegoats.

Unseen hands
that build and clothe,
caught
in the sharp
angry jaw
of rhetoric—

our fields
lay barren,
while he plants
fear.
